isis.stitle: POWER STEERING PUMP: EATON MODEL BB135 R, L - DISASSEMBLE

svcproc.title: DISASSEMBLE
svcproc.para: Before disassembly of pump, remove reservoir filler cap and drain oil from reservoir by inverting the pump so oil may drain out the filler neck.

After oil is drained from reservoir, cap should be replaced and the entire pump assembly washed in a non-toxic solvent to remove all dirt and prevent any foreign matter from contaminating pump components.

note.para: Examine exposed part of drive shaft. If it is corroded, use crocus cloth to remove corrosion before disassembling pump. This will prevent damage to the shaft bushing which might require replacement of the entire housing.

step1.para: Place pump in a bench vise using the mounting (gear driven pump) or mounting bracket (belt driven pump) to hold pump.

caution.para: Do not clamp on the pump, reservoir or pulley.

step1.para: Remove bolt and washers for retaining pulley or drive gear. Remove pulley or drive gear with universal three-arm puller. Remove Woodruff key from shaft.
Remove spring loaded reservoir cover, wing nut and washer. Remove and discard gasket.
Remove filter relief spring. Remove and discard filter cap and filter.
Unscrew 5/16 inch cover stud.
Remove 1-1/8 inch hex reservoir stud. Remove and discard seal on stud ( Figure 4).
Remove 5/16 inch thread bolts and reinforcement plate from inside reservoir. Remove reservoir and discard seals from the pump reservoir mounting pad.
Clean all reservoir components except filter and seals with a mineral spirit solvent.
Loosen but do not remove 1-1/4 inch hex valve cap.
Loosen but do not remove 3/8-16 bolts attaching bracket and/or pump body to cover ( Figure 5). Note bracket position for reassembly.
Remove pump assembly from vise and then remove loosened bolts.
Use a stable block or the pulley or flange previously removed, loosely piloted onto the pump shaft to steady the pump base for continued disassembly ( Figure 6).
Carefully remove cover casting by pulling and gently tapping cover casting ( Figure 7). Use caution not to allow pumping element components to be removed with cover.

Remove 1-1/4 inch hex valve cap and discard O-ring. Remove valve spring and combination (flow control and relief) valve from cover casting by shaking or gently striking the casting on a wood or padded surface. Do not use metal tools or instruments which may cause valve bore damage.
Remove and discard body face seals ( Figure 8).

figure.caption: Figure 8. Body and Face Seal Removal

step1.para: Carefully remove roller vanes from exposed pumping element in bay pocket ( Figure 9). This is best accomplished by using a clean magnet but demagnetize parts after using one. Do not use pliers or similar tools which may raise a burr.

caution.para: The position and "UP" side of all remaining internal components must now be noted and marked for reference at reassembly. Any marking method must not damage any surface. Use dye or other semi-permanent marker.

step1.para: Remove the carrier by sliding it out over the exposed shaft end ( Figure 10). On gear driven pumps, carrier and shaft are held together by snap rings. Remove both as a complete unit. Make sure any gear drive key has been removed prior to shaft/carrier removal from body.
Remove carrier drive key from shaft keyway.
Record and/or mark position of locating pin, cam (note the reference arrow direction), port plate, and end plate for reassembly reference.

Remove the cam ring, locating pin, port plate, and end plate by sliding parts out of the pump body pocket. Note position of stacked end plate seals for reassembly. Then remove end plate seals from end plate pockets and save for possible reuse ( Figure 11).

Remove the shaft-bearing sub-assembly on pulley driven pumps by making certain the carrier drive key has been removed, and displacing the bearing snap ring retainer ( Figure 12). Slide shaft and bearing out of the body casting ( Figure 13). Light tapping on the shaft end may be required. DO NOT use excessive force since bearing damage may result.

Remove the flange (and bearing assembly) on direct drive pumps by removing the three 3/8-16 Allen head bolts and lockwashers. If required, carefully scrape gasket and sealant from the flange/pump mating surfaces.

Carefully remove the shaft oil seal in the body casting, being careful not to damage the shaft bushing. A small diameter punch placed against the seal from the cam pocket side may be used to drive the seal out of the bore ( Figure 14). Some direct drive pumps may have two opposite facing oil seals.
